intro: Leptemon verrucosum, commonly known as the rough-leaved leptemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The botanical features of Leptemon verrucosum make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
